intro: Phacelia sericea subsp. idahoensis, commonly known as Idaho silky phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and sagebrush steppe. It is often found in regions of Idaho and adjacent states, where it thrives in full sun. Its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators make it a notable species in local ecosystems.
